elements.title: Andriy Kovalchuk
elements.contents: ... that Major-General Andriy Kovalchuk (pictured), commander of the 2022 Ukrainian southern counteroffensive, met his wife, a fellow officer, when she chastised him for wearing an unpolished belt buckle?

elements.title: toasting forks
elements.contents: ... that extendable marshmallow toasting forks were cited as an example of how glamping has "ruined" camping?

elements.title: Silvia Hauer
elements.contents: ... that Silvia Hauer, a singer of Rossini's Rosina and Bizet's Carmen at Staatstheater Wiesbaden, performed the mezzo-soprano solo of Verdi's Requiem in 2022?

elements.title: Parallax Graphics
elements.contents: ... that Mike Judge's three-month tenure at the video-card manufacturer Parallax Graphics was an inspiration for Office Space?

elements.title: R.I.P.
elements.contents: ... that it was rumored that "R.I.P." was initially intended for Rihanna, but it became a song for Rita Ora instead?

elements.title: Bruce Timm
elements.contents: ... that Bruce Timm created most of the character designs for Batman: The Animated Series?

elements.title: upheld West Virginia's largest punitive damages award in history
elements.contents: ... that in 1993, the U.S. Supreme Court upheld West Virginia's largest punitive damages award in history, awarding $10 million – 526 times larger than the compensatory damages?

elements.title: Mini mum
elements.contents: ... that Mini mum is miniscule, but it is not Mini scule?
